title: Why are opinions of editors published as news? - Quora

response.answer_text: In America, opinions are published as opinions. News(papers) are simply the vehicle for dissemination and delivery. The other part of the equation is reception and processing. A reader has the onus of discerning and determining news worthiness, not the newspaper publisher. Last time I checked my news(paper) literally led with news. It‘s not until I arrive several pages in to a section clearly labeled “opinion/editorial” that the publisher announces and alerts the reader to the transition. Yes, I have a high school education and then some. It prepared me to recognize and understand the distinction between news and opinion, no matter where or how they are published. I admit to helping abandoned and neglected animals more than I help humans. I hope this response will balance the scales for a moment.

They are not, in most cases, in the USA, editors opinions that I have seen over 60 years ARE on the opinion pages as opinions. Once in a great while for a specific reason, editors in the USA, Might print an OPINION from Editors on the front page. Like who they endorse for Mayor, Governor, President or should America go to war. Even if printed on the front page from what I remember the editors will NOTE that this article AN OPINION.
